abstracts.cdata!:
The project will support the fight
            against HIV/AIDS epidemic in Guinea, by minimizing
            socioeconomic impacts at the individual, family, and
            community levels. The main project objectives will include
            initiatives by the public, and private sectors to strengthen
            the institutional framework, and build capacities responsive
            to the epidemic. However, the presence of biomedical wastes
            within the framework of the project, poses adverse
            environmental impacts, due to the potential, inadequate
            handling of infected materials. This environmental
            assessment addresses specifically the management of
            biomedical wastes, and examines the institutional capacity
            within health institutions and local authorities, to propose
            a feasible plan of action to reduce HIV/AIDS infection
            risks. Measures to mitigate biomedical wastes disposal are
            as follows. Institutional, legal and regulatory frameworks
            will be strengthened through inter-governmental efforts, and
            enforced environmentally sound waste management practices
            will take effect. Health facilities will be provided with
            sanitary equipment for the collection, and removal of
            biomedical wastes, as well as trained personnel in
            precautionary practices for handling infected, or
            non-sterilized medical wastes. Incinerators will be
            installed for hospital uses. Additionally, training and
            specific programs will be conducted for health providers,
            doctors, and municipal and sanitation personnel on the
            related risks between AIDS and biomedical waste disposal.
            Public awareness, and dissemination information on the
            direct, and indirect risks of inappropriate wastes handling
            will be organized through media channels, to sensitize
            communities. Infrastructure related works should consider
            adequate treatment of effluent discharges (at the municipal
            level), including systematic incineration plans, and
            compacted waste disposal.
